definition: enoki mushroom (Flammulina velutipes, Japanese えのき茸 enokitake), used in cuisines of Japan, Korea and China, cultivated to be long, thin and white/abbr. to 金菇
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: The research aimed to study the main ingredients of fresh and saline Flammulina velutipes F21.
sentences.chinese: 研究新鮮和鹽漬F21金針菇主要成分的含量。

sentences.english: The mushroom are rolled in the marinated pork slices and sent into oven to roast for 10mins.
sentences.chinese: 然後金針菇就卷在這些豬肉片送進烤箱裏。

sentences.english: So applying growth regulating substances in the culture of Flammulina velutipes is safe.
sentences.chinese: 因此，在金針菇栽培中使用生長調節物質是安全的。

sentences.english: Flammulina velutipes and its complete amino acid sequence.
sentences.chinese: 金針菇和其完整的氨基酸序列。

sentences.english: Mulberry branch powder was proved to be the ideal material for the cultivation of Flammulina velutipe.
sentences.chinese: 因此，桑枝屑是一種優良的金針菇栽培材料。

definition: black-boned chicken/silky fowl/silkie/Gallus gallus domesticus Brisson
radish (Raphanus sativus), esp. white radish 白蘿蔔|白萝卜[bai2 luo2 bo5]/CL:條|条[tiao2]
